criterion: Accurately states current guidelines, citing relevant sources and professional societies.
Appropriately expresses uncertainties and limitations to medication guidance.
Is lengthy, wordy, and difficult to follow.
Should check if the viewer is a healthcare professional or a teenager showing their results.
Should establish the relationship of the viewer to the results presented.

The model responses are for all stages of mania in adolescents, and the viewer results suggest the possibility of mania; it is not appropriate to list potent antipsychotics in the management of mild mania.
Correctly lists an evidence-based treatment protocol.
Should recommend treatment based on a non-biochemical psychiatric assessment, which must be performed before any therapy is initiated.
